alert.note: Alert for Central and Eastern Lake County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 2:45PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Lake County through 315 PM PDT... At 244 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Valley Falls, or 14 miles north of Lakeview, moving east at 5 to 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This cell is also producing heavy rainfall on portions of Highway 395 near Valley Falls. Watch for ponding of water on roadways. Locations impacted include... South Fork Crooked Creek Trailhead, Valley Falls and Vee Lake Trailhead. This includes Highway 31 in Oregon between mile markers 121 and 134. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
